casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Atilano Saldana SALDANA, Defendant-Appellant. No. 13-14937

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. May 23, 2014. Cherie Krigsman, Arthur Lee Bentley, III, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Tampa, FL, Tama Caldarone, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Fort Myers, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Adeel Bashir, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Tampa, FL, Rosemary Cakmis, Donna Lee Elm, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Orlando, FL, Martin Derovane-sian, Federal Public Defender, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Fort Myers, FL, Atilano Saldana Saldana, D. Ray James CF, Folkston, GA, for Defendant-Appellant. Before HULL, PRYOR and MARTIN, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

Adeel Bashir, appointed counsel for Ati-lano Saldana in this direct criminal appeal, has moved to withdraw from further representation of the appellant and filed a *708brief pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED, and Saldana’s conviction and sentence are AFFIRMED.
